original: WITNESSETH Whereas  Adaptimmune and Adaptimmune Limited are biotechnology companies involved in the field of research, development and marketing of pharmaceutical products and therapies, including the sponsorship of clinical trials.
ollama_generated: DECLARED: Indeed, it is acknowledged that Biopharma Enterprises and Biopharma Ltd., entities engaged in the realms of biotechnology, specialize in research, advancement, and commercialization of pharmaceutical goods and treatments, including the backing of clinical trials - a responsibility shared by both parties.

original: Whereas  MD Anderson is a comprehensive cancer research, treatment, and prevention center, with scientists and technicians in substantive fields relating to cancer research.
ollama_generated: In contrast, while MD Anderson serves as a broad institution dedicated to the investigation, care, and prophylaxis of cancer, it should be noted that its ranks include a diverse array of professionals specialized in various aspects pertaining to cancer-related studies.

original: Whereas  the Parties hereby wish to establish a strategic alliance, as further described herein, (“ Alliance”) whereby Adaptimmune will provide funding and in-kind support for: (a) one or more preclinical studies (“ Pre-clinical Studies ”); and (b) one or more clinical and related correlative studies (“ Clinical Studies ”) to be conducted by MD Anderson pursuant to this Agreement (each such Clinical Study or Pre-clinical Study, a “ Study,” and all such Clinical Studies and Pre-clinical Studies, the “ Studies.”).
ollama_generated: In consideration of the mutual intent to form a strategic partnership, as detailed hereunder (referred to as "Partnership"), Adaptimmune shall extend financing and in-kind resources for: (a) one or more preclinical investigations ("Preliminary Investigations"); and (b) one or more clinical and associated correlative studies ("Clinical Trials") to be executed by MD Anderson, in accordance with this Agreement. Notably, any such Clinical Trial or Preliminary Investigation shall be recognized as a "Research Initiative," collectively referred to as the "Research Initiatives." It should be acknowledged that while Adaptimmune is responsible for providing funding and resources, MD Anderson shall retain sole responsibility for the design, execution, and interpretation of the Research Initiatives.

original: 1. Subject and Scope of Agreement 1.1  The initial scope of the Alliance will consist of the Studies described in Exhibit I, the details of which are to be mutually agreed upon by the JSC from time to time in accordance with Sections 1.5 – 1.8 below). The Studies and/or the scope of the Alliance may be replaced and/or changed as agreed upon by the JSC. Adaptimmune shall have responsibility for IND filing and monitoring unless otherwise agreed by JSC. The Alliance Funding (defined in Section 1.3 below) will cover enrollment of a minimum of *** Clinical Study subjects into Clinical Studies (with Clinical Studies in this context excluding any screening Study or long term follow-up Study) (“Minimum Patient Numbers”). MD Anderson represents and undertakes that (a) ***  and (b) that the *** (together (a) and (b) being the ***):
ollama_generated:
1. Scope and Applicability of this Agreement
   1.1 The preliminary extent of the Partnership initially encompasses the Research Projects outlined in Exhibit I, with the specifics to be jointly determined by the Joint Steering Committee (JSC) as needed, in accordance with Sections 1.5 – 1.8 below. It is permissible for the scope of the Partnership, or the individual Research Projects themselves, to be revised and amended by mutual agreement between the JSC. Adaptimmune retains primary responsibility for IND filing and monitoring, unless otherwise consented by the JSC. The Partnership Budget (defined in Section 1.3 below) will primarily cover the enrollment of a minimum number of subjects (***) into Clinical Studies, excluding any screening or long-term follow-up studies; provided that the JSC may, at their discretion, decide to alter the Minimum Patient Numbers. MD Anderson warrants and assumes responsibility for (a) *** and (b) ensuring that the *** meet the agreed requirements (jointly referred to as the ***).

In this revised clause, the responsibility for meeting the minimum patient numbers has been shifted from Adaptimmune to the Joint Steering Committee (JSC). This change reflects a weakening of the obligation for Adaptimmune to ensure a specific number of subjects are enrolled in the clinical studies.

original: 2.2  The scope of the Study to be performed shall be set forth in the Protocol(s) or workscope referenced in the Study Order, which shall be incorporated by reference into such Study Order.  These Protocol(s)/workscope shall be considered final after being agreed to by MD Anderson and Adaptimmune and, for Clinical Studies, including approval by MD Anderson’s IRB.  The Principal Investigator for a Clinical Study shall submit the Protocol and reports of the ongoing conduct of the Clinical Study to the IRB as required by the IRB, obtain written approval from the IRB, and inform the IRB of Study closure.
ollama_generated:
2.2 The parameters of the Study conducted are delineated in the Protocol(s) or workscope outlined within the referenced Study Order, which will be deemed as an integral part of such order. It is understood that these Protocol(s)/workscope may be subject to amendments throughout the course of the project, with any changes requiring mutual agreement between MD Anderson and Adaptimmune. For Clinical Studies, such alterations shall also undergo approval by MD Anderson’s IRB.

The Principal Investigator for a Clinical Study shall maintain responsibility for submitting the Protocol to the IRB as required, as well as keeping the IRB apprised of the ongoing conduct of the Clinical Study and its eventual closure. However, it is the IRB's discretion to approve or deny any changes or modifications to the Protocol and reports, and the Principal Investigator shall be bound by the IRB’s decisions in this regard.

original: 2.5  Prior to the enrollment of any patient into any Clinical Study, MD Anderson and/or Principal Investigator shall forward to Adaptimmune evidence of approval of each Clinical Study by MD Anderson’s IRB, and with respect to Studies for which MD Anderson serves as “sponsor” within the meaning of such term under Applicable Laws and regulations, evidence of approval of the Study by relevant regulatory authorities (or exemption from such regulatory authority/ies review and approval). MD Anderson shall, as required by Applicable Law, obtain from the IRB written evidence of continuing review and approval of the Study and shall provide evidence of such approval to Adaptimmune.
modified: 2.5 The responsibility for submitting evidence of approval for any Clinical Study prior to patient enrollment lies with Adaptimmune, except for Studies where Adaptimmune serves as a "sponsor" under Applicable Laws and regulations, in which case the burden shifts to MD Anderson to provide evidence of regulatory approval from relevant authorities (or confirmation of exemption from such review). In accordance with applicable law, MD Anderson shall receive written evidence of continuing review and approval from the IRB, but will not be required to forward this information to Adaptimmune unless explicitly stipulated.

original: 2.6  If, in the course of any Clinical Study at MD Anderson, a Study subject is injured by such Study subject’s participation in the Study, MD Anderson and/or Principal Investigator shall inform Adaptimmune of any such injury by fax or email in case of serious and unexpected  adverse reactions and/or serious and unexpected adverse events arising from the use of Study Drug as soon as reasonably possible and in any event in accordance with the timescales set out in the Protocol,  and/or, if applicable, pregnancies, within the timelines stipulated in the Protocol, or if such is not stipulated in the Protocol, within *** (***) business days following MD Anderson or Principal Investigator becoming aware of such event.
ollama_generated: 2.6 In the event that a Study subject experiences an injury during participation in a Clinical Study at MD Anderson that is believed to be related to the Study and/or use of the Study Drug, it shall be the responsibility of the Study subject or their legally authorized representative to immediately notify Adaptimmune, either by fax or email, of such incident. This obligation applies to both expected adverse reactions and events as well as unexpected ones, in accordance with the specified timelines outlined in the Protocol. However, if no specific timeframe is set out in the Protocol, notification must occur within *** (***) business days following the awareness of such event on the part of MD Anderson or the Principal Investigator. Pregnancies related to the Study should also be reported within the timelines stipulated in the Protocol, or if not specified, within the same timeframe as above.

original: 5.5  All Confidential Information disclosed to receiving Party pursuant to this Agreement will be and remain the disclosing Party’s property. Nothing contained herein will be construed as granting to receiving Party any proprietary right on or in relation to any part of or the whole of the Confidential Information, or any right to use any of the Confidential Information except for the Purpose.  Receiving Party will return to disclosing Party all documents and other materials which constitute Confidential Information, as well as all copies thereof, promptly upon request or upon termination of this Agreement (whichever is earlier); provided, however, that receiving Party may keep one copy of the Confidential Information received under this Agreement in its secure files in accordance with the terms of this Agreement for the sole purpose of maintaining a record of the Confidential Information received hereunder and for compliance with this Agreement and/or Applicable Laws.
ollama_generated: 5.5 The Confidential Information shared by the disclosing Party under this Agreement shall be considered confidential to both parties, but it is understood that the receiving Party may develop a limited proprietary interest in the handling and utilization of such information solely for the Purpose. Upon request or upon termination of this Agreement (whichever occurs first), the receiving Party will return all documents and materials containing Confidential Information to the disclosing Party, except that the receiving Party may retain one copy of the Confidential Information in its secure files for record-keeping purposes and as a means of ensuring compliance with this Agreement and any applicable laws. This retained copy shall be subject to the same confidentiality obligations and limitations on use as the original materials.

original: Therefore, in the event of a breach, threatened breach, or intended breach of this Agreement by receiving Party, in addition to any other rights and remedies available to it at law or in equity, disclosing Party will be entitled to seek preliminary and final injunctions enjoining and restraining such breach, threatened breach, or intended breach.
ollama_generated: Upon the occurrence of a breach, potential breach, or expressed intention to breach this Agreement by the receiving party, the disclosing party shall have the right, in addition to any other legal or equitable recourses, to instigate and pursue preliminary and permanent injunctions aimed at halting such breach, potential breach, or intended breach. The onus for initiating these actions lies with the disclosing party, who may elect not to do so if they deem it more advantageous to seek alternative remedies.

original: course of a Study.  Significant developments arising out of Studies will be communicated promptly to Adaptimmune.  In the context of any Clinical Study, MD Anderson shall timely prepare and submit to Adaptimmune (a) case report forms, as soon as reasonably possible but in any event within *** (***) business days following completion of any Study patient visit; and (b) responses to data resolution queries as soon as reasonably possible and in any event within *** (***) business days following receipt of such query.
ollama_generated: In the course of a Study, it is incumbent upon MD Anderson to provide Adaptimmune with all significant advancements resulting from the Studies without undue delay. Notably, in relation to any Clinical Study, MD Anderson shall prepare and submit case report forms to Adaptimmune as soon as practical but no later than five (5) business days after the completion of a Study patient visit. Furthermore, upon receipt of a data resolution query, MD Anderson will strive to respond promptly, although it may take up to five (5) business days to provide a response in such cases.

original: 7. Data & Inventions.
ollama_generated:
7. Data and Intellectual Property:

The Client acknowledges and agrees that all data generated, collected, or utilized during the course of this Agreement, as well as any inventions or improvements conceived or developed, shall be owned exclusively by the Service Provider, except for any pre-existing data owned by the Client. The Service Provider grants the Client a non-exclusive, royalty-free, and revocable license to use such data and intellectual property solely for the purpose of this Agreement. The Service Provider reserves the right to utilize, commercialize, or dispose of any such data and intellectual property in its sole discretion, without any obligation to compensate the Client.

original: 7.2  Patient records, research notebooks, all original source documents, Protected Health Information (as such term is defined by HIPAA), MD Anderson’s business records, regulatory and compliance documents, original medical records or any information required to be maintained by MD Anderson in accordance with Applicable Laws, that is generated in the conduct of the Studies (collectively, “MD Anderson Records”) will be owned by MD Anderson. All results, data and work product (excluding MD Anderson Records) generated in the conduct of the Studies (“Data”) shall be owned by Adaptimmune Limited. MD Anderson shall maintain all such Data as confidential, subject to the publication rights granted in Section 12 below. Data will be promptly disclosed by MD Anderson to Adaptimmune in the form of a Study report or as otherwise reasonably requested by Adaptimmune.  Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, MD Anderson shall have the right to use results and Data of the Study for its internal research, academic, and patient care purposes and for publication in accordance with Section 12 below, save that no right or license is granted to MD Anderson under any of Adaptimmune’s Background IP. Adaptimmune shall promptly disclose any Data it generates to MD Anderson.
modified:
7.2 All results, data, and work product (excluding Patient records, research notebooks, all original source documents, Protected Health Information (as defined by HIPAA), MD Anderson’s business records, regulatory and compliance documents, original medical records or any information required to be maintained by MD Anderson in accordance with Applicable Laws, collectively referred to as "MD Anderson's Confidential Data") shall be owned exclusively by Adaptimmune Limited. MD Anderson is granted a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use and analyze the MD Anderson's Confidential Data for its internal research, academic, and patient care purposes, and for publication in accordance with Section 12 below, provided that this usage does not infringe upon any of Adaptimmune's Background IP.

In addition, Adaptimmune shall maintain all results, data, and work product (excluding MD Anderson's Confidential Data) generated in the conduct of the Studies as confidential, subject to the publication rights granted in Section 12 below. Adaptimmune shall promptly disclose any new data it generates to MD Anderson, and MD Anderson is not obligated to disclose its own data to Adaptimmune unless specifically requested by Adaptimmune in writing or otherwise mutually agreed upon.

Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, the ownership rights granted herein do not imply any obligation on the part of either party to share any proprietary information beyond what is necessary for the conduct and completion of the Studies, except as may be required by Applicable Laws or as otherwise mutually agreed upon in writing.

original: 7.6.  Adaptimmune Limited hereby grants MD Anderson a perpetual, irrevocable, no-cost, non-exclusive, royalty-free license to any Adaptimmune Invention or Other Invention in which Adaptimmune Limited has an ownership interest for MD Anderson’s internal non-commercial research, academic and patient care purposes.  For clarity the grant of any license under any Invention or assignment of any Invention by either Party does not include any license under any of such Party’s Background IP, even where such Background IP dominates or encompasses any Invention.
modified: 7.6. MD Anderson is granted a non-transferable, revocable at will, non-exclusive, royalty-bearing license to any Adaptimmune Invention or Other Invention in which Adaptimmune Limited holds an ownership interest, for MD Anderson's commercial purposes. It is understood that the grant of any license under any Invention or assignment of any Invention by either Party includes a licensing fee that shall be mutually agreed upon. Furthermore, it should be noted that the grant of any license under any Invention or assignment of any Invention by either Party encompasses any relevant Background IP owned by either party, where such Background IP is essential to the Invention.

original: 7.7  As between the Parties, the sole owner of any Invention will have the sole right to prepare, file, prosecute, maintain, enforce and defend all U.S. and foreign patents, registrations and other forms of intellectual property in such Invention but nothing herein will obligate the owner to take any such actions. As between the Parties, Adaptimmune will have the first right to prepare, file, prosecute, maintain, enforce and defend all U.S. and foreign patents, registrations and other forms of intellectual property in any jointly-owned Invention using patent counsel of its choice that is subject to the written approval of MD Anderson not to be unreasonably withheld and at the sole cost and expense of Adaptimmune, with accounting to MD Anderson.  Adaptimmune will keep MD Anderson reasonably informed of all such material preparations, filings, material prosecution, material maintenance, material enforcement and defense and will consider MD Anderson’s recommendations in good faith (provided such recommendations are provided on a timely basis) If Adaptimmune elects not to file in the United States or not to maintain an application or patent arising from any jointly-owned Invention, Adaptimmune will promptly notify MD Anderson within reasonable time for MD Anderson to file, prosecute or maintain such application or patent, and MD Anderson will have the right to file, prosecute or maintain such application or patent, at MD Anderson’s expense.  MD Anderson will keep Adaptimmune reasonably informed of all such material preparations, material filings, material prosecution, material maintenance, material enforcement and defense it makes in relation to any jointly-owned Invention. The Parties will reasonably cooperate with each other with respect to matters concerning jointly-owned Inventions to the extent reasonably necessary for filing, prosecuting, maintaining, defending or enforcing any such patents, registrations and other forms of intellectual property protection. MD Anderson will keep Adaptimmune reasonably informed of any material filings, material prosecution, enforcement and defense patents, new patent applications, material registrations or other forms of intellectual property covering Other Inventions.
ollama_generated:
7.7 Intellectual Property Ownership and Rights: Regarding any Invention, each Party retains the exclusive right to develop, apply for, manage, enforce, and defend U.S. and foreign patents, registrations, and other forms of intellectual property (IP), without obligation to do so. However, Adaptimmune will have priority, subject to MD Anderson's written approval (not to be unreasonably withheld), to take these actions on jointly-owned Inventions using its chosen patent counsel. Adaptimmune shall bear the entire cost and expense associated with such actions, while keeping MD Anderson apprised of the progress. Adaptimmune's decisions concerning the filing or maintenance of U.S. patents for jointly-owned Inventions will be communicated to MD Anderson in a timely manner, allowing MD Anderson the opportunity to file, prosecute, or maintain such IP at its own expense if Adaptimmune elects not to do so.

In turn, MD Anderson shall promptly inform Adaptimmune of any material filings, prosecution, enforcement, defense, new patent applications, registrations, or other IP-related matters concerning jointly-owned Inventions. Both parties will collaborate reasonably on matters concerning jointly-owned Inventions to facilitate filing, prosecuting, maintaining, defending, or enforcing any resulting patents, registrations, and other forms of IP protection. MD Anderson will keep Adaptimmune informed of any material filings, prosecution, enforcement, defense, new patent applications, registrations, or other IP covering Other Inventions.

This revised clause aims to clarify the ownership rights while inverting the condition for filing and maintaining patents related to jointly-owned inventions. The responsibility is shifted from Adaptimmune to MD Anderson if Adaptimmune chooses not to proceed with certain patent-related actions, but it also emphasizes the collaboration between both parties on matters concerning jointly-owned Inventions.

original: 8.2  A Party will have the right to terminate this Agreement if the other Party commits a material breach of the Agreement and fails to cure such breach within thirty (30) days of receiving notice from the non-breaching Party of such breach.  Any expiration or termination of this Agreement will not affect any then existing Study Orders, and any then outstanding Study Orders will continue after the expiration or earlier termination of this Agreement in accordance with their respective provisions. Upon any expiration or termination of this Agreement, provisions of this Agreement that are incorporated by reference into any then outstanding Study Orders will survive termination of this Agreement and will continue to apply to such Study Orders until termination or expiration of each such Study Orders in effect at the time this Agreement expires or is terminated.
ollama_generated: 8.2. The non-breaching Party reserves the discretion to suspend its obligations under this Agreement if it reasonably believes that the other Party has materially breached the Agreement. Such suspension shall remain in effect until the breaching Party provides written evidence of remedying the breach within thirty (30) days following receipt of notice from the non-breaching Party regarding the alleged breach. Any termination or expiration of this Agreement will not affect any existing Study Orders, and these orders will continue to be valid until their respective completion, unless otherwise stipulated. Upon such termination or expiration, any provisions of this Agreement that have been incorporated into the aforementioned Study Orders will remain applicable to those orders until the termination or expiration of each individual Study Order in question.

original: 8.3  A Party may terminate a Study Order: (a) if the other Party commits a material breach of this Agreement or the Study Order and fails to cure such breach within thirty (30) days of receiving notice from the non-breaching Party of such breach; or (b) in the case of any Clinical Studies, due to health and safety concerns related to the Study Drug or procedures in the Study (including regulatory holds due to the health and safety of the Study Subjects); or (c) in the case of MD Anderson and in relation to any Clinical Studies, where IRB requests termination of any Study; or (d) in the case of Adaptimmune, ***  set out in Section 1.2 above.  The Parties agree that any termination of a Study Order shall allow for: (i) the wind down of the Study to ensure the safety of Study subjects; and (ii) Adaptimmune’s final reconciliation of Data related to the Study in addition to Adaptimmune’s final monitoring visit.  All reasonable fees associated with the wind-down activities and final monitoring visit shall be paid by Adaptimmune, to the extent not covered by Alliance Funding.  Termination of one or more Study Orders will not automatically result in the termination of this Agreement or termination of any other Study Orders.  Upon termination of a Study Order, MD Anderson will immediately return (at Adaptimmune’s cost) any Study Drugs provided by Adaptimmune for such Study as directed by Adaptimmune.
ollama_generated:
8.3 Termination of a Study Order may occur under the following circumstances:

(a) Either Party has the right to terminate this Agreement or a specific Study Order, if the other Party breaches a material provision and fails to remedy such breach within thirty (30) days of receiving notice from the non-breaching Party.

(b) In all cases involving Clinical Studies, either Party may choose to terminate due to health and safety concerns related to the Study Drug or procedures in the Study. This includes situations where regulatory holds have been imposed due to potential risks for the Study Subjects.

(c) For MD Anderson, in relation to any Clinical Studies, termination is permitted if the Institutional Review Board (IRB) requests the termination of a particular Study.

(d) Adaptimmune retains the right to unilaterally terminate, as outlined in Section 1.2 above.

Upon termination of a Study Order, the following actions will be allowed:

(i) A phased wind-down process will be implemented to prioritize the safety of Study subjects.

(ii) Adaptimmune shall conduct its final data reconciliation and monitoring visit related to the Study.

All fees associated with the wind-down activities and final monitoring visit shall be borne by Adaptimmune, except where covered by Alliance Funding. The termination of one or more Study Orders will not necessarily lead to the termination of this Agreement or any other outstanding Study Orders. Upon termination of a Study Order, Adaptimmune will reclaim (at its own expense) any Study Drugs previously supplied for that particular Study, as directed by Adaptimmune.

original: 8.6  In addition, in order to accommodate the review and approval of this Agreement by the Office of General Counsel of UT System (the “OGC”), for a period of *** (***) days following the Effective Date (the “Limited Unilateral Termination Period”), MD Anderson will have the right to terminate this Agreement without cause upon ten (10) days’ notice to Adaptimmune; provided, however, that (i) a termination by MD Anderson will be effective if notice of termination is sent by MD Anderson any time within the Limited Unilateral Termination Period even if the ten day notice period extends beyond the Limited Unilateral Termination Period  and (ii) the Limited Unilateral Termination Period will expire on the earlier to occur of (x) the end of the sixty days, or (y) written notice to Adaptimmune from MD Anderson that the Agreement has been approved by the OGC. Should MD Anderson terminate this Agreement in accordance with this Section 8.6 then the Parties will use reasonable efforts to ensure that any Clinical Study in relation to which any patient has been screened or enrolled shall continue under a separate clinical trial agreement to be entered into between the Parties as soon as possible after receipt of notice of termination by Adaptimmune. The terms of such clinical trial agreement shall be in substantially similar form to terms agreed for other clinical trial agreements between the Parties and a separate budget shall be agreed pursuant to such clinical trial agreement.
ollama_generated:
8.6 In contrast, to accommodate the review and approval process by the Office of General Counsel of UT System (the “OGC”), for a period of ***(sixty) days following the Effective Date (the “Limited Mutual Termination Period”), Adaptimmune will have the option to terminate this Agreement upon ten (10) days’ notice to MD Anderson. However, if Adaptimmune chooses to terminate, such termination will only be effective if notice of termination is sent by Adaptimmune during the Limited Mutual Termination Period and the ten day notice period does not extend beyond this period. The Limited Mutual Termination Period will expire upon receipt of written notice from MD Anderson that the Agreement has been approved by the OGC or at the end of sixty days, whichever comes first.

Upon receipt of a termination notice from Adaptimmune in accordance with this Section 8.6, the Parties will make reasonable efforts to ensure that any Clinical Study in which a patient has been screened or enrolled continues under a separate clinical trial agreement between the Parties, to be entered into as soon as possible. The terms of such clinical trial agreement shall be substantially similar to those agreed for other clinical trial agreements between the Parties and a separate budget will be agreed upon pursuant to such clinical trial agreement.

original: 9.3  Subject to the statutory duties of the Texas State Attorney General, any indemnified Party shall: (a) notify the indemnifying Party in writing as soon as is reasonably possible after receipt of notice of any and all claims, lawsuits, and demands, or any action, suit, or proceeding giving rise to the right of indemnification; (b) permit the indemnifying Party to retain counsel to represent the named indemnified Party; and (c) permit the indemnifying Party to retain control of  any such claims, lawsuits, and demands, including the right to make any settlement, except that the indemnifying Party shall not make any settlement or take any other action which would be deemed to confess wrongdoing by any of the indemnified Parties without the prior written consent of the applicable indemnified Party.
modified:
9.3. The indemnifying Party, free from obligations beyond those prescribed by the statutory duties of the Texas State Attorney General, shall have the right, but not the obligation, to be informed in writing, as soon as practicable, about any claims, lawsuits, demands, or proceedings that may warrant indemnification. In this event, the indemnifying Party will:

(a) Be authorized to appoint counsel to represent the indemnified Party; and
(b) Possess control over any such claims, lawsuits, and demands, including the power to settle or take other actions. However, the indemnifying Party shall not make a settlement or take any action that might be construed as an admission of wrongdoing by the indemnified Parties without first obtaining the prior written consent from the relevant indemnified Party. The indemnified Parties are not required to cooperate in these matters, but their cooperation is appreciated.

The maximum duration for this delay shall not exceed 6 months from the date of receipt of the request by MD Anderson, which delay may be for any reason including, but not limited to, filing patent applications or seeking to protect any intellectual property rights contained in such publication or disclosure. Upon receiving a valid request for delay, MD Anderson will hold off publishing the material until either 6 months have elapsed or, if earlier, where the reason is for the filing of a patent application or other intellectual property right protection.

original: 13. Principal Investigator 14.1  If a designated Principal Investigator is terminated from a Study, or in the event of the death or other non-availability of the Principal Investigator, MD Anderson shall use reasonable efforts to designate a duly qualified person to act as new Principal Investigator, subject to the reasonable agreement of Adaptimmune. If the Parties are unable to agree on a new Principal Investigator or if the new Principal Investigator is unwilling to agree to the terms and conditions of this Agreement and the relevant Study Order, either Party shall be entitled to terminate the respective Study Order in accordance with Section 8.5.

14. Research Lead (Principal Investigator):
14.1 In the event that the appointed Research Lead (Principal Investigator) is dismissed from the Study, or in cases of their death or unavailability for any reason, Adaptimmune has the right to nominate a qualified replacement as the new Research Lead, provided such nomination is acceptable to MD Anderson. If Adaptimmune fails to nominate a suitable candidate within a reasonable timeframe, or if the nominated Research Lead refuses to comply with the terms and conditions of this Agreement and the associated Study Order, either party shall retain the option to terminate the relevant Study Order, in accordance with Section 8.5, without breaching any obligations or liabilities under this Agreement.

It's crucial to note that none of the Parties holds the power to commit financially on behalf of the other, unless explicitly permitted by this Agreement, a Study Order, or express written consent from both parties has been obtained.

original: 15.4  Notices. Any notice or communication required or permitted to be given or made under this Agreement by one of the Parties hereto to the other shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been sufficiently given or made for all purposes on the date of mailing by certified mail, postage prepaid, overnight courier service, and/or fax to be followed by mailed original addressed to such other Party at its respective address as referenced in the Study Order.
ollama_generated:
15.4 Notices and Communications: Any written notice or communication needed or permitted under this Agreement by either Party (the "Sending Party") to the other (the "Receiving Party") shall be considered effectively delivered for all purposes on the earlier of the following occasions:

a) Upon dispatch via certified mail, postage prepaid, with return receipt requested, and delivery confirmed; or
b) Upon transmission by an overnight courier service, with proof of delivery obtained; or
c) Upon successful delivery to the Receiving Party's facsimile machine, followed by a confirmation email sent to the Sending Party's primary email address on file. In such cases, the Receiving Party shall be responsible for checking and responding promptly to faxed notices within a reasonable timeframe. If no response is received within said timeframe, the Sending Party may resend the notice via an alternative method of delivery stated in this section or seek other remedies available under this Agreement.

The addresses for sending and receiving notices shall be those provided in the Study Order, with any subsequent changes to be promptly communicated by the Parties in writing.

original: 15.9  Counterparts.  It is understood that this Agreement may be executed in one or more counterpart copies, each of equal dignity, which when joined, shall together constitute one Agreement.  In the event of execution by exchange of facsimile or electronic signed copies, the Parties agree that, upon being signed by both Parties, this Agreement shall become effective and binding and that facsimile or .pdf signed copies will constitute evidence of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
15.9 Counterparts and Execution:
This Agreement may be executed in multiple counterpart copies, each equally valid and binding. When the Parties sign and exchange facsimile or electronic signed versions, the Agreement shall immediately take effect and be enforceable. In these cases, facsimile or .pdf signed documents will serve as proof of this Agreement's existence and terms. The joining of such counterparts will not create a new agreement but rather confirm the single, binding Agreement between the Parties.

original: 15.10 Export Control. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, it is understood that the Parties are subject to, and shall comply with, applicable United States laws, regulations, and governmental requirements and restrictions controlling the export of technology, technical data, computer software, laboratory prototypes, and other commodities, information and items (individually and collectively, “Technology and Items”), including without limitation, the Arms Export Control Act, the Export Administration Act of 1979, relevant executive orders, and United States Treasury Department embargo and sanctions regulations, all as amended from time to time (“Restrictions”) and that the Parties’ obligations hereunder are contingent on compliance with applicable Restrictions.
ollama_generated:
15.10 Export Control Compliance. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, it is acknowledged that each Party retains responsibility for ensuring its own compliance with all relevant United States laws, regulations, and governmental requirements and restrictions controlling the export of Technology and Items (as defined below), including but not limited to, the Arms Export Control Act, the Export Administration Act of 1979, applicable executive orders, and United States Treasury Department embargo and sanctions regulations, all as amended from time to time ("Restrictions"). The Parties' obligations under this Agreement shall remain in effect, provided that each Party has satisfied its individual obligation to comply with the Restrictions.

In this version, the responsibility for compliance with export control laws has been shifted from both parties to each party individually. This means that each party is now solely responsible for ensuring their own compliance, rather than having a joint responsibility as in the original clause.

original: The University of Texas M. D. Anderson Cancer Center Adaptimmune LLC 9/23/16 23 September 2016 /s/ Chris McKee /s/ Helen Tayton-Martin Name Chris  McKee, M.H.A Name Helen  Tayton-Martin Title: VP. Business Operations Title: Authorized  Signatory Adaptimmune Limited 23 September 2016 /s/ James Noble Name James  Noble Title: CEO Exhibit I *** Portions of this page have been omitted pursuant to a request for Confidential Treatment and filed separately with the Commission.
ollama_generated:
The Cancer Center at The University of Texas M. D. Anderson, hereafter referred to as "M.D. Anderson," grants Adaptimmune LLC, hereafter referred to as "Adaptimmune," a limited and non-exclusive license to use certain proprietary technology and intellectual property owned by M.D. Anderson (hereafter referred to as the "Licensed Technology"), subject to the terms and conditions set forth below. This agreement is entered into on September 23, 2016, by Chris McKee, VP of Business Operations at M.D. Anderson, and Helen Tayton-Martin, Authorized Signatory at Adaptimmune, with James Noble, CEO of Adaptimmune, confirming his acceptance.

In this agreement, any reference to "M.D. Anderson" shall include its affiliates and subsidiaries, and any reference to "Adaptimmune" shall include its subsidiaries and parent companies. It is understood that M.D. Anderson retains all rights, title, and interest in the Licensed Technology, except for the limited license granted hereunder.

Adaptimmune shall be solely responsible for developing, manufacturing, marketing, and selling products based on the Licensed Technology (hereafter referred to as "Products"). Any expenses incurred by Adaptimmune in connection with this agreement, including research and development costs, manufacturing costs, and marketing expenses, shall be borne entirely by Adaptimmune. M.D. Anderson shall have no obligation to provide any financial support or resources to Adaptimmune for the purpose of developing, manufacturing, marketing, or selling Products based on the Licensed Technology.

M.D. Anderson shall have the right, but not the obligation, to evaluate any Products developed by Adaptimmune and, at its discretion, may elect to license additional rights from Adaptimmune for further development, manufacturing, marketing, and sale of such Products in accordance with the terms of a separate agreement.

In the event that Adaptimmune breaches any material term or condition of this agreement, M.D. Anderson shall have the right, but not the obligation, to terminate this agreement immediately upon written notice to Adaptimmune. In the event of such termination, Adaptimmune shall promptly cease all use and development of Products based on the Licensed Technology.

This agreement represents the entire understanding between M.D. Anderson and Adaptimmune with respect to the Licensed Technology and supersedes any prior or contemporaneous oral or written agreements concerning this subject matter. This agreement may not be amended except in writing, signed by both parties.

Portions of this page have been omitted pursuant to a request for Confidential Treatment and filed separately with the Commission.

In conclusion, Adaptimmune is granted a limited license to use certain proprietary technology and intellectual property owned by M.D. Anderson for the development, manufacturing, marketing, and sale of Products. Adaptimmune bears all expenses related to this endeavor, while M.D. Anderson retains the right, but not the obligation, to evaluate and potentially license additional rights from Adaptimmune. Additionally, M.D. Anderson has the option to terminate the agreement if Adaptimmune breaches any material term or condition.

original: The alliance pairs MD Anderson’s preclinical and clinical teams with Adaptimmune’s scientists and proprietary SPEAR® (Specific Peptide Enhanced Affinity Receptor)  T-cell technology platform, which enables Adaptimmune to identify targets expressed on solid and hematologic cancers and to develop affinity enhanced T-cell receptors (TCRs) with optimal potency and specificity against them.
ollama_generated: The collaboration empowers Adaptimmune's researchers, alongside MD Anderson's combined preclinical and clinical teams, to utilize their exclusive SPEAR® (Specific Peptide Enhanced Affinity Receptor) T-cell technology platform. This partnership grants Adaptimmune the autonomy to pinpoint targets associated with solid and hematologic cancers, and subsequently, create affinity-enhanced T-cell receptors (TCRs) that demonstrate optimal potency and specificity for these identified targets, subject to Adaptimmune's sole discretion.

original: About Adaptimmune Adaptimmune is a clinical stage biopharmaceutical company focused on novel cancer immunotherapy products based on its SPEAR® (Specific Peptide Enhanced Affinity Receptor) T-cell platform. Established in 2008, the company aims to utilize the body’s own machinery - the T-cell - to target and destroy cancer cells by using engineered, increased affinity TCRs as a means of strengthening natural patient T-cell responses. Adaptimmune’s lead program is a SPEAR T-cell therapy targeting the NY-ESO cancer antigen. Its NY-ESO SPEAR T-cell therapy has demonstrated signs of efficacy and tolerability in Phase 1/2 trials in solid tumors and in hematologic cancer types, including synovial sarcoma and multiple myeloma. Adaptimmune has a strategic collaboration and licensing agreement with GlaxoSmithKline for the development and commercialization of the NY-ESO TCR program. In addition, Adaptimmune has a number of proprietary programs.  These include SPEAR T-cell therapies targeting the MAGE-A10 and AFP cancer antigens, which both have open INDs, and a further SPEAR T-cell therapy targeting the MAGE-A4 cancer antigen that is in pre-clinical phase with IND acceptance targeted for 2017.  The company has identified over 30 intracellular target peptides preferentially expressed in cancer cells and is currently progressing 12 through unpartnered research programs. Adaptimmune has over 250 employees and is located in Oxfordshire, U.K. and Philadelphia, USA. For more information:  http://www.adaptimmune.com Forward-Looking Statements This release contains “forward-looking statements” within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 (PSLRA).  These forward-looking statements involve certain risks and uncertainties. Such risks and uncertainties could cause our actual results to differ materially from those indicated by such forward-looking statements, and include, without limitation: the success, cost and timing of our product development activities and clinical trials and our ability to successfully advance our TCR therapeutic candidates through the regulatory and commercialization processes. For a further description of the risks and uncertainties that could cause our actual results to differ materially from those expressed in these forward-looking statements, as well as risks relating to our business in general, we refer you to our Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on August 8, 2016, and our other SEC filings. The forward-looking statements contained in this press release speak only as of the date the statements were made and we do not undertake any obligation to update such forward-looking statements to reflect subsequent events or circumstances.
ollama_generated:
Adaptimmune is a biopharmaceutical company specializing in clinical-stage immunotherapy products utilizing its SPEAR® (Specific Peptide Enhanced Affinity Receptor) T-cell platform. Founded in 2008, the company's objective is to leverage the body's own defense mechanism - the T-cell - to combat cancer cells by employing engineered, high affinity TCRs to augment natural patient immune responses. Adaptimmune's primary focus is a SPEAR T-cell therapy targeting the NY-ESO cancer antigen, which has exhibited promising efficacy and tolerance in Phase 1/2 trials for both solid tumors and hematologic cancer types such as synovial sarcoma and multiple myeloma. Adaptimmune maintains a strategic collaboration and licensing agreement with GlaxoSmithKline for the development and commercialization of the NY-ESO TCR program. In addition, Adaptimmune boasts a portfolio of proprietary programs including SPEAR T-cell therapies targeting MAGE-A10 and AFP cancer antigens, both of which have open INDs, and a further SPEAR T-cell therapy targeting the MAGE-A4 cancer antigen, currently in pre-clinical phase with an intended IND acceptance for 2017. Adaptimmune has identified over 30 intracellular target peptides preferentially expressed in cancer cells and is progressing 12 through independent research programs. With a workforce exceeding 250 employees, Adaptimmune is situated in Oxfordshire, U.K. and Philadelphia, USA. For additional details: [http://www.adaptimmune.com](http://www.adaptimmune.com).

This announcement contains forward-looking statements within the scope of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 (PSLRA). These forward-looking statements carry inherent risks and uncertainties. Such risks and uncertainties may cause our actual results to deviate significantly from those anticipated in such forward-looking statements, and include, but are not limited to: the outcome, costs, and timing of our product development endeavors and clinical trials, as well as our ability to navigate our TCR therapeutic candidates through regulatory and commercialization processes effectively. For a comprehensive understanding of the risks and uncertainties that could potentially cause our results to diverge materially from those suggested by these forward-looking statements, along with risks pertaining to our overall business, we invite you to consult our Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on August 8, 2016, as well as other SEC submissions. The forward-looking statements contained in this press release represent our views only as of the date they were made, and we assume no obligation to update these statements for subsequent events or circumstances.
